definition: anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious
(literary) Oh!/Ah!
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
surname Yu/Taiwan pr. [Yu2]
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Finally, the Yang Sen's over-anxious and compulsory policy should be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 最後，對楊森的急於求成和強制政策要給予批評。

sentences.english: A man in such a hurry as you are to get results seldom learns quickly.
sentences.chinese: 一個人向你這樣急於求成是不會有很快進步的。

sentences.english: We are not in a rush for quick results, since the reform should advance gradually in due order.
sentences.chinese: 我們不急於求成，改革要循序漸進地推進。

sentences.english: But I have the impression they are getting too ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 但我的感覺是他們過於急於求成。

sentences.english: But China does not want to rush.
sentences.chinese: 但中國並不想急於求成。

sentences.english: We belong to a generation that wants to see the results of our work.
sentences.chinese: 我們屬於急於求成的一代人。

definition: lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
magnanimous
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
loyal/sincere/sound
to advance prematurely
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
to accumulate over a long period of time
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
to have a sense of shame
to be strict with oneself
